#Text=Adopt a Pet if You 're a Senior
#Text=As a senior it can be hard to get out and about , so a nice companion in the home is a good opportunity for company and a source of happiness .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide which pet is best for you .
#Text=If you have limited mobility it is probably best to go for a low maintenance pet that wo n't require regular physical exercise and constant clean up .
#Text=A cat , a hamster , or a bird may be a good choice if you want a pet you can physically interact with .
#Text=However , aquarium pets can bring much joy and are very easy to maintain .

#Text=If you are n't a fish person , many aquarium hobbyists are fascinated with colorful species of dwarf shrimp , dwarf frogs , and if your budget is n't tight , jellyfish are currently being domesticated .
#Text=Research your decided pet .

#Text=Obviously you will have already done some of this to make the decision , but in-depth knowledge on the specifics will be needed in order to have a successful relationship between you and your pets .
#Text=Knowing things such as diseases the species and/or breed is prone to , the amount of space needed , and special care or treatment commonly needed in old age .
#Text=Other details such as portion amounts , what might annoy your pet , and what pleases them will also be useful in growing the bond between you and your new friend .
#Text=Make sure the requirements of the pet fit your lifestyle .
#Text=Never cut corners with an animal .
#Text=Check that if you live in an apartment complex that the needs of your pet comply with the standards set by the landlord .
#Text=Also , make sure the services and care you can provide meet ( better yet , exceed ) the requirements of your pet .
#Text=Prepare for the arrival of your new friend .
#Text=Purchase all needed materials and assemble them before you purchase your new pet .
#Text=This will make the transition from the pet store to their forever home much less stressful , for both the pet and yourself .
#Text=For cats and dogs , make sure that you are purchasing from a healthy pet from a reputable breeder .
#Text=An independent breeder is your best bet since you can in most cases see the parents and the conditions they have been living in .
#Text=If you do go to a pet store to purchase the animal , ask lots of questions and talk to someone informed .
#Text=Pick the best available animal : one that looks healthy with a friendly demeanor .
#Text=Make sure if they are contained , their container will not fall over on the way home .
#Text=If they are to be let roam around ( which is not advised )
#Text=make sure they are in an area where they will not disrupt your driving .
#Text=Take caution around them for the first couple weeks .
#Text=Make sure they are comfortable and do n't show signs of stress or disease .
#Text=If they do , be sure to call the solicitor and let them know .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you find yourself incapable of physically going out to purchase the supplies and pet , most pet stores will happily ship the supplies to your step .
#Text=In the matter of purchasing the actual pet , shipping would not be in the pets best interest .
#Text=However , employing a neighbor or youth would be perfectly fine .
#Text=The Internet these days lets you preview the stock of mammals in most pet stores .
#Text=If you are going for reptilian or aquatic , just inform the person picking them up of what to look for and if you have specific color preferences .
